result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy T Mitchell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Stalking [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Repeater, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concur to all other cases. Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program. Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
Concurrent with: all other cases

superMiscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge and court costs remitted. $192 to be collected by the Dept of Corrections. DOC can take 25% of any and all funds in defendant's prisoner account including but not limited to 25% of gifts, wages or other funds.
Obtain GED or high school diploma or equivalency.
Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with CRS.
Not to use or possess weapons of any kind.

Mental health assessment and treatment required by agent. Completion of DOC domestic violence treatment. Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified. DNA on file. Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Timothy T Mitchell

records.addlTxt: of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Copy of minutes from PLEAS Hrg on 9/14/22 sent electronically to DCJ

*** IN CUSTODY ***

9:28 AM Defendant Timothy T Mitchell in court with Attorney Devonte D Windham.  ADA John D Rice in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count 1.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

On Motion of the State, the Court DISM 939.62(1)(b) repeater on Count 1. 

Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT #1
Court sentences DE to:
-serve 4 years  in WSP, bifurcated into:
-initial confinement: 2 years
-extended supervision: 2 years
-cc to all other cases

Challenge Incarceration Program: Not Eligible
Substance Abuse Program: Not Eligible

CONDITIONS
-Obtain GED or high school diploma or equivalency
-No contact with: CRS
-DOC DV treatment 
-Mental Health Assessment and treatment required by agent.
-Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals
-Not to use of possess weapons of any kind
-DNA on file
-Any other conditions DOC may impose

COURT COSTS:
Ct #1
- DA surcharge
- All CC and DNA surcharge waived. DA surcharge and V/W surcharge to be paid through DOC.
- DOC can take 25% of any and all funds in Defendant's prisoner account including but not limited to 25% of gifts, wagers or other funds

CREDIT
-Days credit for time served: 45 days credit  
-Days credit to Prison: 45 days credit

-DE advised of post-conviction rights

Abby H./minutes sent to DOC
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial on November 9, 2022 at 08:00 am.
Jury selection on November 7, 2022 at 08:00 am.
Jury status hearing on October 31, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

*** IN CUSTODY ***

3:47 PM ADA Carl Jacob Lazarus in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Timothy T Mitchell in court with Attorney Devonte D Windham. 
RE: MOTION TO MODIFY BOND
Statement by Attorney Windham in support of Motion. Statement by ADA Lazarus in Objection to Motion. Court Denies Motion for reasons stated on the record. All conditions remain the same. 
Oral demand for speedy trial placed on the record. Trial dates selected.

*** IN CUSTODY ***

3:47 PM ADA Carl Jacob Lazarus in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Timothy T Mitchell in court with Attorney Devonte D Windham. Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.
Bail/bond hearing on August 10, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Arraignment on August 10, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Trial Judge - Br 11 - Arraingment with trial branch

11:15 AM Court reporter Rowan Thompson. Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Paul Fredrickson on behalf of Devonte Windham.  Tomas Valerio appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of right to and waived Preliminary Hearing (Preliminary Hearing Waiver signed); Court accepted waiver of Preliminary Hearing and ordered case bound over.

ADDRESS INFO for Timothy T Mitchell
Current: c/o DCJ,   (Effective: 07-14-2022)
Prior: 1819 Aberg Ave, Madison, WI 53704 United States
Atty Devonte Windham
Preliminary hearing on July 14, 2022 at 10:30 am.

- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process if required. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with CRS. 
- The Court finds substantial evidence that knowing and malicious prevention or dissuasion of the above victim(s) is reasonably likely to occur. The above conditions of release are hereby ordered pursuant to Sec. 940.47 and Chapter 969. 
- Defendant shall not be on Gunderson St. 
- Defendant shall not be at any residence of CRS. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 11

02:32 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Will Rice Anderson.  Tomas Fernando Valerio appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 10:30 am.
